results.title: Living with dust
results.brief_description: Made for the Audio Visual Communications Centre, Minnesota Mining and Manufacturing Co., the film presents causes of dust in nature and industry and gives methods of controlling these conditions. It tells how different dusts affect workers and what can be done to protect them.

results.title: Living with breast cancer
results.creator_credit: Anti Cancer Council, Giovanna Pignaiosa, Gillian Fawcett, Cancer Council Victoria and Speaking From Experience
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Speaking from experience”.
Breast cancer is a malignant tumor in the breast. The severity of the disease depends on the size of the cancer and whether it has spread to other parts of the body. This excellent and informative documentary presents five women of varying age, who have all experienced the trauma of breast cancer. Each woman relates her own personal story from the initial diagnosis and having to deal with the reality, to surgery and treatment and finally to recovery and the future. Various types of surgery, chemotherapy, and radiotherapy are discussed including the side effects, physical and emotional, and the important role self-image can play in the road to recovery. Also stresses that the key to recovery is through support from family and friends in terms of encouragement, offers of help in daily routines, and generally in just being there. A common factor with each of the women is the way their outlook on life has changed, valuing each day as precious and maintaining a positive attitude as a means to coping with the disease. A warm and enlightening progam.

results.title: Living with Aids
results.creator_credit: Shayne Mooney and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description: Shayne Mooney interviews four men with two things in common - they are all gay and HIV positive. Two of the men, Colin (27), a photographer, and Ian, were filmed in the final stages of their lives. Peter Charlton and Chris Carter, political researcher, were HIV positive but had not then developed AIDS. The four men discuss how the illness has affected their lives, the discrimination they have experienced and how they have come to terms with the prospect of death with the help of AIDS support workers. It is an inspirational program that shows the triumph of the human spirit over suffering and death.

results.title: Living with a giant
results.brief_description: Reviews the dominance of Canada by the giant nation on her border, the United States of America. The film explores how the proximity of the US has impacted on Canada’s trade and business, recreation and independent way of life. Includes footage of a meeting between John F. Kennedy and the Prime Minister of Canada.

results.title: Living way out
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Otton, Film Australia and Philip Robertson
results.brief_description: Depicts life in Shay Gap, a remote mining town in Western Australia. Residents and a social planner speak of the problems of isolation - stress, boredom and loneliness - and how they attempt to resolve them.
